verses.kjv: And, behold, there came a man of God out of Judah by the word of the LORD unto Bethel: and Jeroboam stood by the altar to burn incense.
verses.ct: A man of God arrived in Bethel from Judah, directed by the word of the LORD. Jeroboam was standing beside the altar, about to burn incense.

verses.kjv: And he cried against the altar in the word of the LORD, and said, O altar, altar, thus saith the LORD; Behold, a child shall be born unto the house of David, Josiah by name; and upon thee shall he offer the priests of the high places that burn incense upon thee, and men’s bones shall be burnt upon thee.
verses.ct: The man cried out against the altar by the word of the LORD and said, "Altar, altar! This is what the LORD says: A son will be born to the house of David, named Josiah. He will sacrifice the priests of the high places who burn incense on you, and human bones will be burned on you."

verses.kjv: And he gave a sign the same day, saying, This is the sign which the LORD hath spoken; Behold, the altar shall be rent, and the ashes that are upon it shall be poured out.
verses.ct: That same day he gave a confirming sign, saying, "This is the sign the LORD has declared: the altar will split apart, and the ashes on it will spill out."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when king Jeroboam heard the saying of the man of God, which had cried against the altar in Bethel, that he put forth his hand from the altar, saying, Lay hold on him. And his hand, which he put forth against him, dried up, so that he could not pull it in again to him.
verses.ct: When King Jeroboam heard what the man of God proclaimed against the altar in Bethel, he stretched out his hand from the altar and ordered, "Grab him!" But the hand he had extended toward the man shriveled up, and he couldn't pull it back.

verses.kjv: The altar also was rent, and the ashes poured out from the altar, according to the sign which the man of God had given by the word of the LORD.
verses.ct: The altar also split apart, and the ashes spilled out from it, exactly matching the sign the man of God had given by the word of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the king answered and said unto the man of God, Intreat now the face of the LORD thy God, and pray for me, that my hand may be restored me again. And the man of God besought the LORD, and the king’s hand was restored him again, and became as it was before.
verses.ct: The king responded to the man of God, "Please plead with the LORD your God and pray for me so that my hand can be restored." The man of God pleaded with the LORD, and the king's hand was restored and became normal again.

verses.kjv: And the king said unto the man of God, Come home with me, and refresh thyself, and I will give thee a reward.
verses.ct: Then the king said to the man of God, "Come to my home with me. Have a meal, and I'll give you a gift."

verses.kjv: And the man of God said unto the king, If thou wilt give me half thine house, I will not go in with thee, neither will I eat bread nor drink water in this place:
verses.ct: But the man of God told the king, "Even if you offered me half of everything you own, I wouldn't go with you. I won't eat food or drink water in this place,

verses.kjv: For so was it charged me by the word of the LORD, saying, Eat no bread, nor drink water, nor turn again by the same way that thou camest.
verses.ct: because the LORD commanded me through his word: 'Don't eat food, don't drink water, and don't go back the same route you came.'"

verses.kjv: So he went another way, and returned not by the way that he came to Bethel.
verses.ct: So he took a different road and didn't return by the route he had used to reach Bethel.

verses.kjv: Now there dwelt an old prophet in Bethel; and his sons came and told him all the works that the man of God had done that day in Bethel: the words which he had spoken unto the king, them they told also to their father.
verses.ct: Now an old prophet was living in Bethel. His sons came and described to him everything the man of God had done that day in Bethel, including the words he had spoken to the king.

verses.kjv: And their father said unto them, What way went he? For his sons had seen what way the man of God went, which came from Judah.
verses.ct: Their father asked them, "Which direction did he go?" His sons had watched which road the man of God from Judah had taken.

verses.kjv: And he said unto his sons, Saddle me the ass. So they saddled him the ass: and he rode thereon,
verses.ct: He told his sons, "Get the donkey ready for me." So they saddled the donkey, and he got on it.

verses.kjv: And went after the man of God, and found him sitting under an oak: and he said unto him, Art thou the man of God that camest from Judah? And he said, I am.
verses.ct: He followed after the man of God and found him sitting under an oak tree. He asked him, "Are you the man of God who came from Judah?" He answered, "I am."

verses.kjv: Then he said unto him, Come home with me, and eat bread.
verses.ct: Then the old prophet said to him, "Come home with me and have something to eat."

verses.kjv: And he said, I may not return with thee, nor go in with thee: neither will I eat bread nor drink water with thee in this place:
verses.ct: But the man of God replied, "I can't go back with you or come to your home. I won't eat food or drink water with you in this place,

verses.kjv: For it was said to me by the word of the LORD, Thou shalt eat no bread nor drink water there, nor turn again to go by the way that thou camest.
verses.ct: because the LORD told me through his word, 'You must not eat food or drink water there, and you must not return by the route you came.'"

verses.kjv: He said unto him, I am a prophet also as thou art; and an angel spake unto me by the word of the LORD, saying, Bring him back with thee into thine house, that he may eat bread and drink water. But he lied unto him.
verses.ct: The old prophet said to him, "I'm also a prophet, just like you. An angel spoke to me by the word of the LORD, saying, 'Bring him back to your house so he can eat food and drink water.'" But he was lying to him.

verses.kjv: So he went back with him, and did eat bread in his house, and drank water.
verses.ct: So the man of God went back with him, ate food at his house, and drank water.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they sat at the table, that the word of the LORD came unto the prophet that brought him back:
verses.ct: While they were sitting at the table, the word of the LORD came to the prophet who had brought him back.

verses.kjv: And he cried unto the man of God that came from Judah, saying, Thus saith the LORD, Forasmuch as thou hast disobeyed the mouth of the LORD, and hast not kept the commandment which the LORD thy God commanded thee,
verses.ct: He called out to the man of God who had come from Judah, "This is what the LORD says: Because you have defied the LORD's command and have not obeyed the instruction that the LORD your God gave you,

verses.kjv: But camest back, and hast eaten bread and drunk water in the place, of the which the Lord did say to thee, Eat no bread, and drink no water; thy carcase shall not come unto the sepulchre of thy fathers.
verses.ct: but instead came back and ate food and drank water in the place where the Lord told you not to eat or drink — your body will not be buried in the tomb of your ancestors."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, after he had eaten bread, and after he had drunk, that he saddled for him the ass, to wit, for the prophet whom he had brought back.
verses.ct: After the man of God had finished eating and drinking, the old prophet saddled the donkey for him — for the prophet he had brought back.

verses.kjv: And when he was gone, a lion met him by the way, and slew him: and his carcase was cast in the way, and the ass stood by it, the lion also stood by the carcase.
verses.ct: As the man of God traveled on his way, a lion encountered him on the road and killed him. His body lay on the road, with the donkey standing beside it and the lion also standing beside the body.

verses.kjv: And, behold, men passed by, and saw the carcase cast in the way, and the lion standing by the carcase: and they came and told it in the city where the old prophet dwelt.
verses.ct: Some people passing by saw the body lying on the road with the lion standing next to it. They went and reported it in the city where the old prophet lived.

verses.kjv: And when the prophet that brought him back from the way heard thereof, he said, It is the man of God, who was disobedient unto the word of the LORD: therefore the LORD hath delivered him unto the lion, which hath torn him, and slain him, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake unto him.
verses.ct: When the prophet who had brought him back heard about it, he said, "That's the man of God who disobeyed the LORD's command. So the LORD handed him over to the lion, which mauled him and killed him, just as the LORD had warned him."

verses.kjv: And he spake to his sons, saying, Saddle me the ass. And they saddled him.
verses.ct: Then he told his sons, "Get the donkey ready for me." So they saddled it.

verses.kjv: And he went and found his carcase cast in the way, and the ass and the lion standing by the carcase: the lion had not eaten the carcase, nor torn the ass.
verses.ct: He went out and found the body lying on the road, with the donkey and the lion standing beside it. The lion had not eaten the body or attacked the donkey.

verses.kjv: And the prophet took up the carcase of the man of God, and laid it upon the ass, and brought it back: and the old prophet came to the city, to mourn and to bury him.
verses.ct: The old prophet lifted the body of the man of God onto the donkey and brought it back. He returned to the city to grieve over him and bury him.

verses.kjv: And he laid his carcase in his own grave; and they mourned over him, saying, Alas, my brother!
verses.ct: He placed the body in his own tomb, and they mourned over him, crying, "What a tragedy, my brother!"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, after he had buried him, that he spake to his sons, saying, When I am dead, then bury me in the sepulchre wherein the man of God is buried; lay my bones beside his bones:
verses.ct: After he had buried him, he told his sons, "When I die, bury me in the same tomb where the man of God is buried. Place my bones right next to his bones,

verses.kjv: For the saying which he cried by the word of the LORD against the altar in Bethel, and against all the houses of the high places which are in the cities of Samaria, shall surely come to pass.
verses.ct: because the message he proclaimed by the word of the LORD against the altar in Bethel and against all the shrines on the high places throughout the towns of Samaria will absolutely come true."

verses.kjv: After this thing Jeroboam returned not from his evil way, but made again of the lowest of the people priests of the high places: whosoever would, he consecrated him, and he became one of the priests of the high places.
verses.ct: Even after all this, Jeroboam did not turn from his wicked ways. Instead, he continued appointing priests for the high places from all sorts of people. Anyone who wanted the role, he ordained as a priest of the high places.

verses.kjv: And this thing became sin unto the house of Jeroboam, even to cut it off, and to destroy it from off the face of the earth.
verses.ct: This practice became the sin of Jeroboam's dynasty — a sin that would lead to its downfall and total destruction from the surface of the earth.
